intro: Ehretia lanyuensis, commonly known as the Lanyu Ehretia, is a flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the family Elaeocarpaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows in forested areas and has simple, ovate leaves with a smooth texture. It is notable for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its aesthetic appeal. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare species within its native habitat.
